page.title: 04The Old Town, Bexhill
page.content: Bexhill is mainly a modern town, although the earliest reference to Bexhill is in the{Doomsday Book.}It refers to it as the{Paramount Manor of {Bexelei.}It is thought that the name comes from the Saxon name beck which means a brook or stream. Bexhill Old Town is on a slight hill and there are a number of old buildings standing including the Church (St. Peters), the Manor House and a number of shops and houses. On one of the buildings there is an old clock which was purchased by a public collection to mark Queen Victoria's jubilee in 1887. It has Roman numbers round the outside and in the middle of the face it has 1887 and V.R. which stands for Victoria Regina.
